result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven A Gaeth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: At the restitution hearing held July 21, 2015 the Court ordered the defendant to pay restitution in the amount of $17,500.00 at the rate of $200/month as a condition of probation for the 31 months remaining on the term of probation.  Any oustanding balance upon the termination of probation shall be entered as a civil judgment against the defendant.
If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact with the Johnston family or their residence.

Defendant shall not possess/consume any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Defendant shall not possess any firearms.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.

Defendant shall provide DNA sample

Defendant shall take all medications as prescribed and only as prescribed, and shall notify his agent within 48 hours with any change in prescribed medication.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

superMiscConds.notes:
Defendant shall not possess/consume any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Defendant shall have contact with Sara K only as allowed by agent.

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact with the victims or their residence.

Defendant shall not associate with any known drug users/dealers.

Defendant shall not possess any firearms.

Defendant shall not enter establishmens whose primary purpose is the sale/service of alcohol.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.

Defendant shall provide DNA sample.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall obtain/maintain full-time employment, schooling, or combination of both.

Defendant shall obtain/maintain stable residence.

Defendant shall pay any outstanding financial obligations as previously ordered.  If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision.  If extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with financial obligations owing, a judgment shall be entered.
Court orders entry of civil judgment for amount of restitution as previously ordered.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Matthew E. Weil.  Atty Mark D. Bensen for State.  Clerk: CP.  Agreement reached; State to file Information w/in 48 hrs.  State moves to dismiss and read-in Ct 2; Court so orders.  Def enters guilty plea to Ct 1.  Court finds def guilty on Ct 1.  Statements from State, counsel and def.  Court proceeds to sentencing. Def appears in custody & w/Atty Matthew E. Weil.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper for State. WITNESS: Deputy J.B. (WCSD);  Testimony closed;  Court finds state has met burden of proof and binds def over for trial; Statement State, Defense;  Arraignment scheduled for March 25, 2015 at 09:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 2, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Matthew E. Weil.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper for State.  Clerk: CP.  State files amended complaint; Court reviews and finds probable cause.  Def req preliminary hearing.  Def req bond modification; Court denies request and keeps bond as previously set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Not possess any weapons of any kind. No  contact with C.J. & D.J. or residence noted on bond form.
Hearing on December 29, 2014 at 09:45 am.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Katherine Romanowich of State Public Defenders Office.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson for State.  Clerk: CP.  Court questions State re complaint; ADA Schepper now also appears.  Court questions Atty Schepper.  State moves to amend complaint to show one count of Theft of Movable Property - Felony, 943.20(1)(a)(3)(bf).  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found re one count as it relates to theft of firearm; if other charge should be re theft of jewelry, State shall file amended complaint.  Court sets $500 cash bond.  SPD will represent.  Def waives time limits on preliminary hearing; Court accepts waiver.    Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for December 29, 2014 at 09:45 am.
